p: The ex situ X-ray powder diffraction patterns of the MgTa 2N 3 sample collected after the electrochemical and chemical oxidation tests are shown in Figure 1 D. Compared with the pristine phase, neither peak shifts nor formation of extra phases are observed, this pointing to insignificant (if any) Mg de-insertion from MgTa 2N 3, even under the severe oxidizing conditions employed and the electrochemical capacity observed being related to side reactions most likely involving electrolyte decomposition. Attempts to insert additional Mg 2+ ions in the MgTa 2N 3 structure were carried out by electrochemical reduction in Mg cells at 100 Â°C, using a 0.3 M Mg(TFSI) 2, EC/PC 1:1 electrolyte, which resulted in very low capacities and no changes in the X-ray powder diffraction patterns.
